references.paper_title: On the utility of learning about humans for human-AI coordination
references.reason: This paper introduces the Overcooked benchmark, a key environment used in the current paper for evaluating human-AI cooperation.

references.paper_title: Generating diverse cooperative agents by learning incompatible policies
references.reason: This work explores methods for creating diverse simulated agents to improve the generalization of cooperative agents, a central theme in the current paper.

references.paper_title: Collaborating with humans without human data
references.reason: This paper tackles the challenge of human-AI coordination without relying on human data, a problem that the current paper addresses by using generative models.
This paper proposes a novel approach to zero-shot coordination using a population of agents, which is compared and contrasted to the current paper’s generative model approach.
This paper investigates the impact of diversity in simulated agents on the ability of cooperative agents to generalize to human partners, a problem also tackled by the current work.
